Subjective: Irritated left eye since Tuesday morning. Redness, red veins, and discomfort. No trauma, no foreign body sensation. No vision problems. No pain when looking straight ahead. No extra pain from light. No flu-like symptoms. No other health issues. Works full-time, managing a child alone for 10 days. ICE: Worried about worsening or contagion.
Objective: Eyes: Redness, red veins, and discomfort in left eye. Right eye also shows redness. Pupils react normally. No foreign body sensation. No vision problems. No pain when looking straight ahead. No extra pain from light.
Assessment: Inflammation of the surface layer of the eye, likely viral in nature. Ruled out: Bacterial infection.
Plan: 1. Avoid rubbing the eye. 2. Use artificial tears (drops) to soothe the eye. 3. Wait 2 weeks for resolution. 4. Return if symptoms worsen, persist, or if there is pus or pain. 5. Antibiotic drops may be prescribed if bacterial infection is suspected.
